channel.title: PHP file which hosts my server?
channel.description:
Ok, so i have now uploaded my server folder to my website.
Now i need a PHP file which will host my server, i'm also sure it will make the ip something to do with the website too?
Anyone got that PHP file? As im not too good with php coding.
Don't post "learn php" I'm simply asking for this 1 thing.
Thanks for all the help - Proview -

item.title: PHP file which hosts my server?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

There’s a (horrible) PHP-Java bridge for Windows (with a fix on Linux only), although I don’t know if this would be a good way of accessing server files written in Java.

You could make a PHP file execute a Java file (which was posted above), but that’s just like running the server through CMD/Terminal.

Read full topic
item.source: PHP file which hosts my server?

item.title: PHP file which hosts my server?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

http://php.net/java

I don’t even know what’s on the page, it won’t load for me. Our connection at work is terrible at times. But I know this would have to be set up by the host in order to work. I also highly doubt any webhost will allow it without an additional fee. This would be the “right” way to run java from php. Otherwise, you can try to use exec(“java -classpath /i/dont/know/how/everyone/runs/their/damn/servers.jar boat”)

And both ways, your host will not be pleased without some extra funding.

Read full topic
item.source: PHP file which hosts my server?

item.title: PHP file which hosts my server?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:9, topic:206258”]You cant neccessarily (and efficiently) run a server in PHP. Yes, it can be done (I’ve talked to a few people about this) but would take too much time and the webmaster would eventually find out.

I dont know what you’re trying to say. Try again.[/quote]I’m not really going to ask how it could be done because it doesn’t make sense.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP file which hosts my server?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

you can do it if you have java/jdk installed on the web server machine and you uploaded your java/class files…

[code]

<? exec("java -cp .;. server"); ?>[/code]

something like that… (the page will never finish loading, but the server will run)

PS: Moparscape is gay.

Read full topic
